BaseComponent
description: This is the BaseComponent class which all elements within the FormioForm derive from.

name: tableView
description:
Provides a table view for this component. Override if you wish to do something different than using getView
method of your instance.

name: constructor
description: Initialize a new BaseComponent.

params.name: component
params.description: The component JSON you wish to initialize.

params.name: data
params.description: The global data submission object this component will belong.

name: _hasCondition
description: Determines if this component has a condition assigned to it.

name: data
description: The data object in which this component resides.

name: component
description: The Form.io component JSON schema.

name: element
description: The bounding HTML Element which this component is rendered.

name: tbody
description: The HTML Element for the table body. This is relevant for the "multiple" flag on inputs.

name: labelElement
description: The HTMLElement that is assigned to the label of this component.

name: errorElement
description: The HTMLElement for which the errors are rendered for this component (usually underneath the component).

name: error
description: The existing error that this component has.

name: inputs
description: An array of all of the input HTML Elements that have been added to this component.

name: info
description: The basic component information which tells the BaseComponent how to render the input element of the components that derive from this class.

name: row
description: The row path of this component.

name: _disabled
description: Determines if this component is disabled, or not.

name: _visible
description: Determines if this component is visible, or not.

name: pristine
description: If this input has been input and provided value.

name: parent
description: Points to the parent component.

name: root
description: Points to the root component, usually the FormComponent.

name: validators
description: The validators that are assigned to this component.

name: triggerRedraw
description: Used to trigger a redraw event within this component.

name: getModifiedSchema
description: Returns only the schema that is different from the default.

name: schema
description: Returns the JSON schema for this component.

name: t
description: Translate a text using the i18n system.

params.name: params
params.description: The i18n parameters to use for translation.

name: beforeNext
description:
Called before a next page is triggered allowing the components
to perform special functions.

name: beforeSubmit
description:
Called before a submission is triggered allowing the components
to perform special async functions.

name: submissionTimezone
description: Return the submission timezone.

name: build
description: Builds the component.

name: className
description: Retrieves the CSS class name of this component.

unknown.tagValue: {string} - The class name of this component.

return.description: The class name of this component.

name: customStyle
description: Build the custom style from the layout values

name: getElement
description: Returns the outside wrapping element of this component.

name: createElement
description: Create the outside wrapping element for this component.

name: createWrapper
description: Create the input wrapping element. For multiple, this may be the table wrapper for the elements.

name: setPristine
description: Sets the pristine flag for this component.

params.name: pristine
params.description: {boolean} - TRUE to make pristine, FALSE not pristine.

name: addNewValue
description: Adds a new empty value to the data array.

name: addValue
description: Adds a new empty value to the data array, and add a new row to contain it.

name: removeValue
description: Removes a value out of the data array and rebuild the rows.

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the data element to remove.

name: buildRows
description: Rebuild the rows to contain the values of this component.

name: addButton
description: Adds a new button to add new rows to the multiple input elements.

name: name
description: The readible name for this component.

name: errorLabel
description: Returns the error label for this component.

name: errorMessage
description: Get the error message provided a certain type of error.

name: removeButton
description: Creates a new "remove" row button and returns the html element of that button.

unknown.tagValue: {HTMLElement} - The html element of the remove button.

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the row that should be removed.

return.description: The html element of the remove button.

name: createLabel
description: Create the HTML element for the label of this component.

params.name: container
params.description: The containing element that will contain this label.

name: createTooltip
description: Create the HTML element for the tooltip of this component.

params.name: container
params.description: The containing element that will contain this tooltip.

name: createDescription
description: Creates the description block for this input field.

name: createErrorElement
description: Creates a new error element to hold the errors of this element.

name: addPrefix
description: Adds a prefix html element.

unknown.tagValue: {HTMLElement} - The html element for this prefix.

params.name: inputGroup
params.description: The group that will hold this prefix.

return.description: The html element for this prefix.

name: addSuffix
description: Adds a suffix html element.

unknown.tagValue: {HTMLElement} - The html element for this suffix.

params.name: inputGroup
params.description: The group that will hold this suffix.

return.description: The html element for this suffix.

name: addInputGroup
description: Adds a new input group to hold the input html elements.

params.name: container
params.description: The containing html element for this group.

name: createInput
description: Creates a new input element.

unknown.tagValue: {HTMLElement} - Either the input or the group that contains the input.

params.name: container
params.description: The container which should hold this new input element.

return.description: Either the input or the group that contains the input.

name: widget
description: Returns the instance of the widget for this component.

name: createWidget
description: Creates an instance of a widget for this component.

name: destroy
description: Remove all event handlers.

name: renderTemplate
description: Render a template string into html.

name: hasCondition
description: Determines if this component has a condition defined.

name: conditionallyVisible
description: Check if this component is conditionally visible.

name: checkCondition
description: Checks the condition of this component.

return.description: True if the condition applies to this component.

name: checkConditions
description: Check for conditionals and hide/show the element based on those conditions.

name: fieldLogic
description: Check all triggers and apply necessary actions.

name: addInputError
description: Add a new input error to this element.

name: inContext
description:
Checks to see if a separate component is in the "context" of this component. This is determined by first checking
if they share the same "data" object. It will then walk up the parent tree and compare its parents data objects
with the components data and returns true if they are in the same context.

Different rows of the same EditGrid, for example, are in different contexts.

name: show
description: Hide or Show an element.

name: showElement
description: Show or hide the root element of this component.

name: addInputEventListener
description: Add new input element listeners.

name: addInput
description: Add a new input to this comonent.

name: emptyValue
description: The empty value for this component.

name: hasValue
description: Returns if this component has a value set.

name: value
description: Get the value of this component.

name: rootValue
description: Get the data value at the root level.

name: dataValue
description: Get the static value of this component.

name: dataValue
description: Sets the static value of this component.

name: splice
description: Splice a value from the dataValue.

name: deleteValue
description: Deletes the value of the component.

name: getValueAt
description: Get the value at a specific index.

name: getValue
description: Get the input value of this component.

name: hasChanged
description: Determine if the value of this component has changed.

name: updateOnChange
description: Update the value on change.

name: updateValue
description: Update a value of this component.

name: restoreValue
description: Restore the value of a control.

name: calculateValue
description: Perform a calculated value operation.

return.description: If the value changed during calculation.

name: label
description: Get this component's label text.

name: label
description: Set this component's label text and render it.

name: getRoot
description: Get FormioForm element at the root of this component tree.

name: invalidMessage
description: Returns the invalid message, or empty string if the component is valid.

name: isValid
description: Returns if the component is valid or not.

name: validateMultiple
description: Check if a component is eligible for multiple validation

name: setValueAt
description: Set the value at a specific index.

name: refresh
description: Refreshes the component with a new value.

name: setValue
description: Set the value of this component.

name: resetValue
description: Resets the value of this component.

name: asString
description: Prints out the value of this component as a string value.

name: disabled
description: Return if the component is disabled.

name: disabled
description: Disable this component.

name: clear
description: Destroys and clears a component and returns the current state.

name: elementInfo
description: Get the element information.

name: append
description: Append an element to this elements containing element.

params.name: element
params.description: The DOM element to append to this component.

name: prepend
description: Prepend an element to this elements containing element.

params.name: element
params.description: The DOM element to prepend to this component.

name: removeChild
description: Removes a child from this component.

params.name: element
params.description: The DOM element to remove from this component.

content:
export default [
  {
    type: 'checkbox',
    label: 'Disable Adding / Removing Rows',
    key: 'disableAddingRemovingRows',
    tooltip: 'Check if you want to hide Add Another button and Remove Row button',
    weight: 405,
    input: true,
    clearOnHide: false,
    customConditional: 'show = !data.enableRowGroups',
    calculateValue: 'value = data.enableRowGroups ? true : data.disableAddingRemovingRows;',
  },
  {
    type: 'textfield',
    label: 'Add Another Text',
    key: 'addAnother',
    tooltip: 'Set the text of the Add Another button.',
    placeholder: 'Add Another',
    weight: 410,
    input: true,
    customConditional: 'show = !data.disableAddingRemovingRows'
  },
  {
    type: 'select',
    label: 'Add Another Position',
    key: 'addAnotherPosition',
    dataSrc: 'values',
    tooltip: 'Position for Add Another button with respect to Data Grid Array.',
    defaultValue: 'bottom',
    input: true,
    data: {
      values: [
        { label: 'Top', value: 'top' },
        { label: 'Bottom', value: 'bottom' },
        { label: 'Both', value: 'both' }
      ]
    },
    weight: 411,
    customConditional: 'show = !data.disableAddingRemovingRows'
  },
  {
    type: 'select',
    label: 'Remove Button Placement',
    key: 'removePlacement',
    defaultValue: 'col',
    dataSrc: 'values',
    data: {
      values: [
        { label: 'Right Most Column', value: 'col' },
        { label: 'Row Top-Right corner', value: 'corner' },
      ]
    },
    weight: 412,
    input: true,
    customConditional: 'show = !data.disableAddingRemovingRows'
  },
  {
    type: 'checkbox',
    label: 'Default Open Rows',
    key: 'defaultOpen',
    tooltip: 'Check this if you would like for the rows of the edit grid to be defaulted to opened if values exist.',
    weight: 420,
    input: true
  },
  {
    type: 'checkbox',
    label: 'Equal column width',
    key: 'layoutFixed',
    weight: 430,
    input: true,
  },
  {
    key: 'enableRowGroups',
    type: 'checkbox',
    label: 'Enable Row Groups',
    weight: 440,
    input: true
  },
  {
    label: 'Groups',
    disableAddingRemovingRows: false,
    defaultOpen: false,
    addAnother: '',
    addAnotherPosition: 'bottom',
    mask: false,
    tableView: true,
    alwaysEnabled: false,
    type: 'datagrid',
    input: true,
    key: 'rowGroups',
    components: [
      {
        label: 'Label',
        allowMultipleMasks: false,
        showWordCount: false,
        showCharCount: false,
        tableView: true,
        alwaysEnabled: false,
        type: 'textfield',
        input: true,
        key: 'label',
        widget: {
          type: ''
        },
        row: '0-0'
      },
      {
        label: 'Number of Rows',
        mask: false,
        tableView: true,
        alwaysEnabled: false,
        type: 'number',
        input: true,
        key: 'numberOfRows',
        row: '0-1'
      }
    ],
    weight: 441,
    conditional: { json: { var: 'data.enableRowGroups' } }
  },
  {
    label: 'Hide Group on Header Click',
    type: 'checkbox',
    input: true,
    key: 'groupToggle',
    weight: 442,
    conditional: { json: { var: 'data.enableRowGroups' } }
  }];

everyComponent
description:
Perform a deep iteration over every component, including those
within other container based components.

name: eachComponent
description: Perform an iteration over each component within this container component.

name: getComponent
description:
Returns a component provided a key. This performs a deep search within the
component tree.

params.name: key
params.description: The key of the component to retrieve.

params.name: fn
params.description: Called with the component once found.

name: getComponentById
description: Return a component provided the Id of the component.

params.name: fn
params.description: Called with the component once it is retrieved.

name: createComponent
description: Create a new component and add it to the components array.

name: addComponent
description: Add a new component to the components array.

params.name: component
params.description: The component JSON schema to add.

params.name: element
params.description: The DOM element to append this child to.

params.name: data
params.description: The submission data object to house the data for this component.

params.name: before
params.description: A DOM element to insert this element before.

params.name: noAdd
params.description: If this component should just be created and not added to this nested component.

params.name: state
params.description: The state of the component getting created.

name: removeComponent
description: Remove a component from the components array.

params.name: component
params.description: The component to remove from the components.

params.name: components
params.description: An array of components to remove this component from.

name: removeComponentByKey
description: Removes a component provided the API key of that component.

params.name: key
params.description: The API key of the component to remove.

params.name: fn
params.description: Called once the component is removed.

name: removeComponentById
description: Removes a component provided the Id of the component.

params.name: id
params.description: The Id of the component to remove.

params.name: fn
params.description: Called when the component is removed.

name: checkData
description:
A more performant way to check the conditions, calculations, and validity of
a submission once it has been changed.

name: beforeNext
description: Allow components to hook into the next page trigger to perform their own logic.

name: beforeSubmit
description: Allow components to hook into the submission to provide their own async data.

name: destroy
description: Destroys this component.

Webform
description: Renders a Form.io form within the webpage.

name: constructor
description: Creates a new Form instance.

params.name: element
params.description: The DOM element you wish to render this form within.

params.name: options
params.description: The options to create a new form instance.

params.name: options.saveDraft
params.description: Set this if you would like to enable the save draft feature.

params.name: options.saveDraftThrottle
params.description: The throttle for the save draft feature.

params.name: options.noAlerts
params.description: Set to true to disable the alerts dialog.

params.name: options.i18n
params.description: The translation file for this rendering. @see https://github.com/formio/formio.js/blob/master/i18n.js

params.name: options.template
params.description: Provides a way to inject custom logic into the creation of every element rendered within the form.

name: type
description: The type of this element.

name: nosubmit
description: Determines if this form should submit the API on submit.

name: submitted
description: Determines if the form has tried to be submitted, error or not.

name: submitting
description: Determines if the form is being submitted at the moment.

name: formio
description: The Formio instance for this form.

name: loader
description: The loader HTML element.

name: alert
description: The alert HTML element

name: onSubmission
description: Promise that is triggered when the submission is done loading.

name: onFormBuild
description: Promise that is triggered when the form is done building.

name: submissionSet
description: Determines if this submission is explicitly set.

name: formReady
description: Promise that executes when the form is ready and rendered.

name: formReadyResolve
description: Called when the formReady state of this form has been resolved.

name: formReadyReject
description: Called when this form could not load and is rejected.

name: submissionReady
description: Promise that executes when the submission is ready and rendered.

name: submissionReadyResolve
description: Called when the formReady state of this form has been resolved.

name: submissionReadyReject
description: Called when this form could not load and is rejected.

name: onElement
description: Promise to trigger when the element for this form is established.

name: elementResolve
description: Called when the element has been resolved.

name: language
description: Sets the language for this form.

name: addLanguage
description: Add a language for translations

name: localize
description: Perform the localization initialization.

name: setElement
description: Sets the the outside wrapper element of the Form.

params.name: element
params.description: The element to set as the outside wrapper element for this form.

name: src
description: Get the embed source of the form.

name: loadSubmission
description: Loads the submission if applicable.

name: setSrc
description: Set the src of the form renderer.

name: src
description: Set the Form source, which is typically the Form.io embed URL.

params.name: value
params.description: The value of the form embed url.

name: url
description: Get the embed source of the form.

name: setUrl
description: Sets the url of the form renderer.

name: url
description: Set the form source but don't initialize the form and submission from the url.

params.name: value
params.description: The value of the form embed url.

name: ready
description: Called when both the form and submission have been loaded.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - The promise to trigger when both form and submission have loaded.

return.description: The promise to trigger when both form and submission have loaded.

name: loading
description: Returns if this form is loading.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} - TRUE means the form is loading, FALSE otherwise.

return.description: TRUE means the form is loading, FALSE otherwise.

name: loading
description: Set the loading state for this form, and also show the loader spinner.

params.name: loading
params.description: If this form should be "loading" or not.

name: setForm
description: Sets the JSON schema for the form to be rendered.

params.name: form
params.description: The JSON schema of the form @see https://examples.form.io/example for an example JSON schema.

name: form
description: Gets the form object.

name: form
description: Sets the form value.

name: submission
description: Returns the submission object that was set within this form.

name: submission
description: Sets the submission of a form.

name: setSubmission
description: Sets a submission and returns the promise when it is ready.

name: saveDraft
description: Saves a submission draft.

name: restoreDraft
description: Restores a draft submission based on the user who is authenticated.

params.description: The user id where we need to restore the draft from.

name: createForm
description: Create a new form.

params.name: form
params.description: The form object that is created.

name: render
description: Render the form within the HTML element.

name: setAlert
description: Sets a new alert to display in the error dialog of the form.

params.name: type
params.description: The type of alert to display. "danger", "success", "warning", etc.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to show in the alert.

name: build
description: Build the form.

name: showErrors
description: Show the errors of this form within the alert dialog.

params.name: error
params.description: An optional additional error to display along with the component errors.

name: onSubmit
description: Called when the submission has completed, or if the submission needs to be sent to an external library.

params.name: saved
params.description: Whether or not this submission was saved to the server.

name: onSubmissionError
description: Called when an error occurs during the submission.

name: onChange
description: Trigger the change event for this form.

name: deleteSubmission
description: Send a delete request to the server.

name: cancel
description: Cancels the submission.

name: submit
description: Submits the form.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - A promise when the form is done submitting.

params.name: before
params.description: If this submission occured from the before handlers.

return.description: A promise when the form is done submitting.

content:
# JavaScript powered forms and SDK for Form.io This library is a plain JavaScript form renderer and SDK for Form.io. This allows you to render the JSON schema forms produced by Form.io and render those within your application using plain JavaScript, as well as provides an interface SDK to communicate to the Form.io API's. The benefits of this library include. - Plain JavaScript implementation using ES6 and Modern practices (no jQuery, Angular, React, or any other framework dependency) - Renders a JSON schema as a webform and hooks up that form to the Form.io API's - Complete Form Builder which creates the JSON schema used to render the forms. - Nested components, layouts, Date/Time, Select, Input Masks, and many more included features - Full JavaScript API SDK library on top of Form.io ## Examples and Demonstration To find out more about this library as well as see a demonstration of what you can do with this library, go to the Examples and Demo site @ [https://formio.github.io/formio.js](https://formio.github.io/formio.js) ## Installation To install this SDK into your project, you can use the following command within your terminal. ``` npm install --save formiojs ``` ## Form Building This library has a very powerful JSON form builder, and can be used like the following. ```html
``` This will create a robust Form builder embedded right within your own application. See [Our Demo Page](https://formio.github.io/formio.js/app/builder) for an example. ## Form Rendering The following is a simple example on how to render a form within your HTML application. ```html
``` This will render the following form within your application. ![Alt text](https://monosnap.com/file/iOZ1yB0wPntJLWQwyhdt7ucToLHEfF.png) You can also render JSON directly instead of referencing the embed URL from Form.io. ```js Formio.createForm(document.getElementById('formio'), { components: [ { type: 'textfield', key: 'firstName', label: 'First Name', placeholder: 'Enter your first name.', input: true }, { type: 'textfield', key: 'lastName', label: 'Last Name', placeholder: 'Enter your last name', input: true }, { type: 'button', action: 'submit', label: 'Submit', theme: 'primary' } ] }); ``` This will render the JSON schema of the form within your application. ## JSFiddle A great way to play around with this renderer is to use JSFiddle, which serves as a good sandbox environment. Here is an example that you can fork and make your own! http://jsfiddle.net/travistidwell/v38du9y1/ ## Wizard Rendering This library can also be used to render a form wizard within your application using the same method as rendering a form. The determiniation on whether it should render as a wizard or not is based on the **display** property of the form schema being set to ```wizard```. ```html
``` ## Form Embedding You can also use this library as a JavaScript embedding of the form using a single line of code. For example, to embed the https://examples.form.io/example form within your application you can simply use the following embed code. ```html ``` For an example of how this looks and works, check out the following [Form.io Form Embedding CodePen](http://codepen.io/travist/pen/ggQOBa) ## Full Form Renderer Documentation For a more complete documentation of how to utilize this library within your application go to the [Form Renderer](https://github.com/formio/formio.js/wiki/Form-Renderer) documentation within the [Wiki](https://github.com/formio/formio.js/wiki) # JavaScript SDK In addition to having a Form Renderer within this application, you can also use this library as a JavaScript SDK in your application. For example, to load a Form, and then submit that form you could do the following within your JavaScript. ```html ``` You can also use this within an ES6 application as follows. ```js import Formio from 'formiojs'; let formio = new Formio('https://examples.form.io/example'); formio.loadForm((form) => { console.log(form); formio.saveSubmission({data: { firstName: 'Joe', lastName: 'Smith', email: 'joe@example.com' }}).then((submission) => { console.log(submission); }); }); ``` ## JavaScript SDK Documentation. For more complete documentation over the JavaScript SDK, please take a look at the [JavaScript SDK](https://github.com/formio/formio.js/wiki/JavaScript-API) within the [wiki](https://github.com/formio/formio.js/wiki). ## Full Developer API Documentation To view the full SDK Documentation, go to [Developer SDK Documentation](https://formio.github.io/formio.js/docs/)

{
  "name": "formiojs",
  "version": "3.13.2",
  "description": "Common js library for client side interaction with <form.io>",
  "main": "index.js",
  "files": [
    "dist",
    "lib",
    "utils.js",
    "wizard.js",
    "form.js",
    "embed.js",
    "full.js"

  "pre-commit": [
    "lint"
  ],
  "scripts": {
    "build": "esdoc;gulp build",
    "watch": "babel -w ./src/ --out-dir ./lib/",
    "rebuild": "rm -rf node_modules;npm install;gulp build",
    "tag": "VERSION=$(cat package.json | grep version | head -1 | awk -F: '{ print $2 }' | sed 's/[\",]//g' | tr -d '[[:space:]]');git add -A; git commit -m \"Build $Version\";git push origin master;git tag v$VERSION;git push origin --tags;",
    "publish": "npm test;gulp build;npm run tag;npm publish lib;",
    "lint": "gulp eslint",
    "serve": "jekyll serve --config _config.yml,_config.dev.yml",
    "test": "NODE_OPTIONS=\"--max-old-space-size=4096\" karma start --verbose --single-run",
    "test:watch": "NODE_OPTIONS=\"--max-old-space-size=4096\" karma start --no-single-run --auto-watch"
